title: Cape

properties.name: description
properties.value: Cape is a term applied to any kind of equippable item worn in the cape slot that resembles a cape or cloak (as opposed to a backpack). Below are some of the many different types of cape that players can wear in Old School RuneScape.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:CapesThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Cape
For a full list of items worn in the cape slot, see this table.

Cape is a term applied to any kind of equippable item worn in the cape slot that resembles a cape or cloak (as opposed to a backpack). Below are some of the many different types of cape that players can wear in Old School RuneScape.

Cape Notes
Black cape Obtained by killing a highwayman or bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using black dye on a regular cape.
Blue cape Bought from Valaine's Shop of Champions in the Champions' Guild and Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using blue dye on a regular cape.
Green cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using green dye on a regular cape.
Orange cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using orange dye on a regular cape.
Pink cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using pink dye on a regular cape.
Purple cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using purple dye on a regular cape.
Red cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using red dye on a regular cape.
Yellow cape Bought from Barkers' Haberdashery in Canifis. Made by using yellow dye on a regular cape.
Cabbage cape Bought from Diango's Toy Store in Draynor Village
Cape of legends Bought from Legends Guild Shop of Useful Items in the Legends' Guild after completing the Legends' Quest.
Cape of skulls Obtained from easy Treasure Trails. Skulls the player upon equipping it.
Champion's cape Obtained from Larxus in the Champions' Guild after deating all champions in the Champions' Challenge.
Deadman's cape Bought from Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing for 160 Last Man Standing points.
Eagle cape Made during and after Eagles' Peak quest by bringing 5 eagle feathers, 1 swamp tar, yellow dye and 25 coins to Asyff in Varrock.
Fire cape A reward from defeating TzTok-Jad in the TzHaar Fight Cave.
Gauntlet cape Obtained after completing The Corrupted Gauntlet.
Graceful cape Bought from Grace's Graceful Clothing in the Rogues' Den. Part of Graceful clothing.
Graceful cape (Trailblazer) Graceful cape that is recoloured brown by using a Trailblazer graceful ornament kit on it.
Graceful cape (Agility Arena) Graceful cape that is recoloured dark blue by speaking to Pirate Jackie the Fruit for 250 agility arena tickets requiring the full set to be dyed.
Graceful cape (Hallowed) Graceful cape that is recoloured by using dark dye bought from Mysterious Stranger for 300 hallowed marks.
Graceful cape (Kourend) Graceful cape recoloured to white with 100% favour for every house of Great Kourend by talking to Osten with 15 marks of grace.
Graceful cape (Arceuus) Graceful cape recoloured to the house of Great Kourend of which the player has 100% favour in by talking to Osten with 15 marks of grace
Graceful cape (Hosidius)
Graceful cape (Lovakengj)
Graceful cape (Piscarilius)
Graceful cape (Shayzien)
Guthix cape Reward from the Mage Arena I miniquest.
Saradomin cape
Zamorak cape
Imbued saradomin cape Reward from the Mage Arena II miniquest.
Imbued zamorak cape
Imbued guthix cape
Infernal cape Reward for completing the Inferno.
Jester cape Obtained as a reward from beginner Treasure Trails.
Lunar cape Part of the Lunar equipment acquired during the Lunar Diplomacy quest.
Moonclan cape Part of the Moonclan robes set purchasable at Moon Clan Fine Clothes on Lunar Isle.
Mythical cape Bought from the Mythical Cape Store in the Myths' Guild once the Dragon Slayer II quest is complete.
Obsidian cape Dropped from the various TzHaar monsters or purchased from TzHaar-Hur-Tel's Equipment Store for 90,000 Tokkul.
Obsidian cape (r) Obtained as a reward from master Treasure Trails.
Ornate cape Obtained from completing a clue during the Crack the Clue II event.
Spotted cape Made by brining two spotted kebbit furs and 400 coins to the Fancy Clothes Store in Varrock. Requires 40 Hunter to equip.
Spottier cape Made by brining two dashing kebbit furs and 800 coins to the Fancy Clothes Store in Varrock. Requires 66 Hunter to equip.
Soul cape A reward from the Soul Wars minigame. Has +8 Prayer bonus.
20th anniversary cape A reward from the 20th Anniversary event.
Banana cape A reward from Birthday events, initially in 2021.
Team cape i Obtained as a reward from easy Treasure Trails. Equipping the cape shows other player's wearing the same cape as blue dots the minimap and the left-click attack option is moved to the right-click menu while in the Wilderness.
Team cape x
Team cape zero
Victor's cape (1) Obtained from Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing after winning that number of Last Man Standing games.
Victor's cape (10)
Victor's cape (50)
Victor's cape (100)
Victor's cape (500)
Victor's cape (1000)
Cape seller Cape pattern Pink Yellow Green Blue Red
William Box Team-1 cape Team-11 cape Team-21 cape Team-31 cape Team-41 cape
Ian X Team-2 cape Team-12 cape Team-22 cape Team-32 cape Team-42 cape
Larry Cross Team-3 cape Team-13 cape Team-23 cape Team-33 cape Team-43 cape
Darren Dashed lines Team-4 cape Team-14 cape Team-24 cape Team-34 cape Team-44 cape
Edward Horizontal stripes Team-5 cape Team-15 cape Team-25 cape Team-35 cape Team-45 cape
Richard Box at top Team-6 cape Team-16 cape Team-26 cape Team-36 cape Team-46 cape
Neil Scarab Team-7 cape Team-17 cape Team-27 cape Team-37 cape Team-47 cape
Edmond Circle Team-8 cape Team-18 cape Team-28 cape Team-38 cape Team-48 cape
Simon Outline Team-9 cape Team-19 cape Team-29 cape Team-39 cape Team-49 cape
Sam Claw Team-10 cape Team-20 cape Team-30 cape Team-40 cape Team-50 cape

Capes of Accomplishment[edit | edit source]

Cape Trimmed cape Notes
Agility cape Agility cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Agility from Cap'n Izzy No-Beard.
Attack cape Attack cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Attack from Ajjat.
Construction cape Construction cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Construction from any Estate agent.
Cooking cape Cooking cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Cooking from the Master Chef.
Crafting cape Crafting cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Crafting from the Master Crafter.
Defence cape Defence cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Defence from the Melee combat tutor.
Farming cape Farming cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Farming from Martin the Master Gardener.
Firemaking cape Firemaking cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Firemaking from Ignatius Vulcan.
Fishing cape Fishing cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Fishing from the Master Fisher.
Fletching cape Fletching cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Fletching from Hickton.
Herblore cape Herblore cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Herblore from Kaqemeex.
Hitpoints cape Hitpoints cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Hitpoints from Surgeon General Tafani.
Hunter cape Hunter cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Hunter from the Hunting expert.
Magic cape Magic cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Magic from the Wizard Sinina.
Mining cape Mining cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Mining from the Dwarf (Mining Guild).
Prayer cape Prayer cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Prayer from Brother Jered.
Ranging cape Ranging cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Ranging from the Armour salesman.
Runecraft cape Runecraft cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Runecraft from Aubury.
Slayer cape Slayer cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Slayer from Duradel.
Smithing cape Smithing cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Smithing from Thurgo.
Strength cape Strength cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Strength from Sloane.
Thieving cape Thieving cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Thieving from Martin Thwait.
Woodcutting cape Woodcutting cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins after 99 Woodcutting from Wilfred.
Quest point cape Quest point cape (t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins from the Wise Old Man after all quests have been completed. Can be trimmed with the completion of the Achievement diaries.
Achievement diary cape Achievement diary cape (t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins from Twiggy O'Korn after all diaries have been completed. Can be trimmed and untrimmed at will.
Music cape Music cape(t) Can be obtained for 99,000 coins from Olaf the Bard after all non-holiday music tracks have been unlocked.
Max cape N/A N/A Can be obtained for 2,277,000 coins from Mac after all skills are level 99. May be combined with certain items to create the other max capes (see Max cape).
Max cape variants Original item
Accumulator max cape Ava's accumulator
Ardougne max cape Ardougne cloak 4
Assembler max cape Ava's assembler
Infernal max cape Infernal cape
Fire max cape Fire cape
Mythical max cape Mythical cape
Imbued guthix max cape Imbued guthix cape
Imbued saradomin max cape Imbued saradomin cape
Imbued zamorak max cape Imbued zamorak cape
Guthix max cape Guthix cape
Saradomin max cape Saradomin cape
Zamorak max cape Zamorak cape

Cloaks[edit | edit source]

Cloak Notes
3rd age cloak Obtained as a reward from elite Treasure Trails.
3rd age druidic cloak Obtained as a reward from master Treasure Trails.
Ancient cloak Obtained as a reward from medium Treasure Trails.
Armadyl cloak
Bandos cloak
Guthix cloak
Saradomin cloak
Zamorak cloak
Ardougne cloak 1 Obtained by completing the easy Ardougne Diary.
Ardougne cloak 2 Obtained by completing the medium Ardougne Diary.
Ardougne cloak 3 Obtained by completing the hard Ardougne Diary.
Ardougne cloak 4 Obtained by completing the elite Ardougne Diary.
Castlewars cloak (Saradomin) Bought from Lanthus at Castle Wars for 10 Castle wars tickets.
Castlewars cloak (Zamorak)
Clue hunter cloak Dig with a spade between two willow trees south-east of Yanille as part of Crack the Clue.
Fremennik cyan cloak Bought from Yrsa's Accoutrements in Rellekka for 325 coins
Fremennik brown cloak
Fremennik blue cloak
Fremennik green cloak
Fremennik red cloak
Fremennik grey cloak
Fremennik yellow cloak
Fremennik teal cloak
Fremennik purple cloak
Fremennik pink cloak
Fremennik black cloak
Ghostly cloak Obtained after speaking to Viggora during the Curse of the Empty Lord miniquest. Part of the Ghostly robes.
Ham cloak Obtained from pickpocketing H.A.M. Members or H.A.M. storeroom guards, killing H.A.M. Guards, and Dorgesh-Kaan average chests.
Hooded cloak (Saradomin) Automatically equipped in Castle Wars.
Hooded cloak (Zamorak)
Mourner cloak Obtained from killing a level 11 Mourner on the Arandar path, killing a level 108 Mourner in the Mourner Headquarters, or a chest in the basement of the headquarters.
Wolf cloak Obtained as a reward from medium Treasure Trails.

Other[edit | edit source]

Cape slot items Notes
Ava's attractor Reward from the Animal Magnetism quest with less 50 Ranged and requires 30 to equip. Bought from Ava for 999 coins. Upgradable to accumulator at Ava with 50 Ranged and 75 steel arrows.
Ava's accumulator Reward from the Animal Magnetism quest with 50 Ranged and requires that to equip. Bought from Ava with 50 Ranged for 75 steel arrows and 999 or Ava's attractor.
Ava's assembler Required 70 Ranged to equip. Made by giving Ava Vorkath's head, 75 mithril arrows, and an Ava's accumulator or 4,999 coins.
Bonesack Reward for completing Rag and Bone Man II quest.
Clockwork suit Made during and after the Cold War quest requiring a clockwork, a plank, and silk at a Crafting table 3 in a player-owned house workshop by selecting the Clockwork toy then Clockwork penguin.
Decorative armour (quiver) Bought from the Castle Wars lobby for 40 Castle wars tickets.
Diving apparatus Requires starting the Freeing Pirate Pete subquest of the Recipe for Disaster quest obtained from Murphy.
Explorer backpack Obtained from hard Treasure Trails.
Fish sack Bought for 1,000 Molch pearls from Alry the Angler on Molch Island.
Grain (Recruitment Drive) Used during the bridge section of Recruitment Drive with Sir Spishyus.
Karamjan monkey (item) A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 100 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Kruk jr A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 1,500 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Maniacal monkey (item) A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 500 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Monkey (Monkey Madness II) An monkey that can transform and be worn by the player after completion of Monkey Madness II. Completing the Ape Atoll Agility Course unlocks transformations.
Princely monkey A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 2,000 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Sack of presents Cosmetic reward from the 2016 Christmas event obtainable from Diango.
Scroll sack Obtained from Watson after completing 100 master Treasure Trails.
Shoulder parrot Obtained from beginner Treasure Trails.
Sinhaza shroud tier 1 Obtained from the Mysterious Stranger at the entrance to the Theatre of Blood after completing 100 Theatre of Blood raids.
Sinhaza shroud tier 2 Obtained from the Mysterious Stranger at the entrance to the Theatre of Blood after completing 500 Theatre of Blood raids.
Sinhaza shroud tier 3 Obtained from the Mysterious Stranger at the entrance to the Theatre of Blood after completing 1,000 Theatre of Blood raids.
Sinhaza shroud tier 4 Obtained from the Mysterious Stranger at the entrance to the Theatre of Blood after completing 1,500 Theatre of Blood raids.
Sinhaza shroud tier 5 Obtained from the Mysterious Stranger at the entrance to the Theatre of Blood after completing 2,000 Theatre of Blood raids.
Skeleton monkey (item) A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 1,000 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Snow imp costume tail Cosmetic reward from the 2017 Christmas event obtainable from Diango.
Thieving bag Obtained from hard Treasure Trails.
Xeric's champion Obtained from the Captain Rimor at the entrance to the Chambers of Xeric after completing 2,000 Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode raids.
Xeric's general Obtained from the Captain Rimor at the entrance to the Chambers of Xeric after completing 1,500 Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode raids.
Xeric's guard Obtained from the Captain Rimor at the entrance to the Chambers of Xeric after completing 100 Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode raids.
Xeric's sentinel Obtained from the Captain Rimor at the entrance to the Chambers of Xeric after completing 1,000 Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode raids.
Xeric's warrior Obtained from the Captain Rimor at the entrance to the Chambers of Xeric after completing 500 Chambers of Xeric Challenge Mode raids.
Zombie monkey (item) A transform option of the Monkey (Monkey Madness II) after completing 250 laps of the Ape Atoll Agility Course.
Bronze coffin Obtained by bringing bronze locks and a broken coffin to Dampe
Steel coffin Obtained by bringing steel locks and a broken coffin to Dampe
Black coffin Obtained by bringing black locks and a broken coffin to Dampe
Silver coffin Obtained by bringing silver locks and a broken coffin to Dampe
Gold coffin Obtained by bringing gold locks and a broken coffin to Dampe
